meaning_mnemonic: A <radical>demon</radical> on a <radical>jet</radical> is pretty <kanji>alluring</kanji>. Demons themselves are pretty intriguing, but put one on a jet? Now that’s alluring.

A <radical>tsunami</radical> hits the <radical>sun</radical>, where you're in <radical>prison</radical> with a <radical>spoon</radical> trying to catch some of it before it starts to <kanji>dry up</kanji>. Being in prison on the sun means your <kanji>thirst</kanji> is truly great, and this spoon will help you quench it when the tsunami comes.

The <radical>lineage</radical> radical and the <kanji>lineage</kanji> kanji are the same. Sometimes this kanji can also mean <kanji>system</kanji>. I guess a lineage is a kind of system, if you think about it.

You meet a <radical>woman</radical> from another <radical>clan</radical> under the rising <radical>sun</radical> to prepare for <kanji>marriage</kanji>. Your clan and her clan are standing together as the two of you watch the sun rise together.

On a <radical>scooter</radical> running in one <radical>direction</radical> is a <radical>gun</radical>-toting <radical>child</radical>. This is a terribly dangerous situation, but to the child it is just <kanji>play</kanji>.

Traveling in the <radical>direction</radical> of the ocean, you take a <radical>gun</radical> and shoot a <radical>crab</radical>, then stick a <kanji>flag</kanji> in the beach and claim it as your own. The crab was the only thing standing in the way of you conquering the area. Now that the flag is in the ground, no one can dispute who it belongs to.
The <radical>sun</radical> is being <radical>call</radical>ed on to <radical>boil</radical> the earth by <kanji>illuminating</kanji> it.

The <radical>soul</radical> of a <radical>person</radical> has a <radical>hook</radical> that can make them <kanji>pleasant</kanji>. When you see, hear, or feel something pleasant, can't you feel that hook pressing into the middle of your body?
If you're a <radical>one-sided</radical> paper <radical>anti</radical> (someone against one-sided paper), then you should bind all those one-sided papers into an <kanji>edition</kanji>.
Those that can only eat a <radical>part</radical> of a <radical>shellfish</radical> are probably a bit <kanji>poor</kanji>.

If you look for a <radical>leaf</radical> among the <radical>hills</radical> you will notice they are <kanji>scarce</kanji>. The hills have no trees around them, so there are no leaves. The leaves are scarce here on the hills.
A <radical>scooter</radical> with a <radical>mohawk</radical>, now that's the most <kanji>suitable</kanji> hairstyle you could ever think of for a scooter!

<radical>Beforehand</radical>, to buy a <radical>geoduck</radical>, you have to go to the bank to <kanji>deposit</kanji> enough money. If you don't deposit your money you won't have enough in your account to buy one! They're expensive, after all.
If you do <radical>yoga</radical> <radical>correct</radical>ly, you will not only <kanji>prolong</kanji> your body but your life!

Whenever all the <radical>feathers</radical> start <radical>stand</radical>ing, you know it's time for <kanji>the next</kanji> day. Once the day comes to its end, all feathers start standing up like clockwork.

A <radical>servant</radical> holding a <radical>gun</radical> sits on the <radical>ground</radical> to <radical>see</radical> if he can find something to <kanji>look at</kanji>. The servant is on watch duty and has the gun to protect the perimeter. He patrols the grounds to look at the distance to see if there are any trespassers.

Your <radical>soul</radical> will <radical>cross</radical> through your body and into the <radical>net</radical> of your <radical>clothes</radical> so that you'll be hit with <kanji>nostalgia</kanji> when you wear them again. Nostalgia for all the things that happened every single time you wore those clothes.
Take your <radical>fingers</radical>, put them on this <radical>turtle shell</radical>, and <kanji>push</kanji> push push! Push the turtle right on out of there.
The <radical>tree</radical> <radical>pirate</radical> jumps from a tree and attacks you by hitting you with a <kanji>pillow</kanji>.

A <radical>tsunami</radical> knocks a <radical>cleat</radical> off a <radical>child</radical> and the shoe begins to <kanji>float</kanji> away in the water. This child was just out playing soccer, minding his own business, when the tsunami crashed in and knocked his cleats off his feet. Now the cleat is floating away with the tsunami.

A <radical>tsunami</radical> rips a <radical>flag</radical> off your house in the <radical>rain</radical>, causing a <kanji>leak</kanji> where it was ripped out. The rain and the tsunami combined just tore the flag right off your house. The force was so strong that it actually removed part of the wall, and now you have a leak in your home.

You take some <radical>bamboo</radical> and <radical>attach</radical> it together into a <kanji>token</kanji> of appreciation for your friend. Your friend greatly appreciates this token of friendship.

You give a <radical>shellfish</radical> to a <radical>lifeguard</radical> to <kanji>purchase</kanji> their services. You think lifeguards are interested in normal money? Come on, they're obviously out there using shellfish for their purchases. It's only natural, given their seaside habitat.

You <radical>run</radical> every day and soon you <radical>become</radical> a human that can <kanji>go beyond</kanji> the normal speed limits of man. You run and you run and you run. This training allows you to become super human. You go beyond the limits of a normal human. You become a human who can run really fast.
When you <radical>eat</radical> you want to see the shape of your <radical>gun</radical> from under a <radical>towel</radical>, so you <kanji>decorate</kanji> your house with them.

A <radical>horse</radical> gets trapped in a small room with a <radical>stool</radical> and an <radical>insect</radical>, and together they create a very <kanji>boisterous</kanji> situation. The horse and the insect are both scrambling frantically to get out of the small room, knocking the stool around all over the place.

You fly <radical>north</radical> to the <radical>moon</radical> and break your <kanji>back</kanji> when you finally land on it. You weren’t braced for impact so when you hit the moon, your back took all of the impact.

Point some <radical>fingers</radical> at the <radical>sun</radical> and put some others in your <radical>ear</radical> as you sit on a <radical>stool</radical> — now you can have your <kanji>photograph</kanji> taken. This is a glamour <kanji>photo</kanji>, so you have to be in one of these weird, artsy poses for it to come out juuust right.
The <radical>next</radical> <radical>plate</radical> is the one you will <kanji>steal</kanji>. This one would be too obvious, better wait for the next one.
You're stuck in <radical>prison</radical> with nothing but a <radical>spoon</radical>, and the <kanji>smell</kanji> in here is so bad you’re using the prison spoon to waft it outside as best you can.
If a <radical>tsunami</radical> hits, it's <radical>rain</radical>ing, and you're outside trying to use a <radical>rake</radical>, you're going to be very <kanji>wet</kanji> and <kanji>damp</kanji>.
You've made yourself a <radical>tree</radical> <radical>bookshelf</radical> (that is, a bookshelf cut into a tree), so you build a <kanji>fence</kanji> to keep the riffraff out.
Who is this <radical>woman</radical> <radical>mole</radical>?! It's your <kanji>niece</kanji>!
